Interface ec.meta.Result

public interface interface Result
A Result is an object that gets notified of the result of a computation. It is used in Tether.invoke. Note that it is an error to yield more than once to the same Result.

yieldException(Throwable)
This method is called when the result is an exception, that is, the invoked method threw an exception rather than actually returning.
yieldProblem(Throwable)
This method is called when there was a problem in the act of acquiring a result at all.
yieldValue(Object)
This method is called when the result is a normal return value.

yieldValue 
 public abstract void yieldValue(Object result)
This method is called when the result is a normal return value. If the value is a primitive type, then it is appropriately wrapped (Integer for int, etc.). If the value is void, then the result is null.

Parameters:
result - the result
Throws: ResultFullException
thrown if this Result has already been yielded a value or exception
yieldException 
 public abstract void yieldException(Throwable resultExcpetion)
This method is called when the result is an exception, that is, the invoked method threw an exception rather than actually returning.

Parameters:
resultException - the exception with which the invocation terminated
Throws: ResultFullException
thrown if this Result has already been yielded a value or exception
yieldProblem 
 public abstract void yieldProblem(Throwable resultProblem)
This method is called when there was a problem in the act of acquiring a result at all.

Parameters:
resultProblem - the exception "explaining" the problem with acquiring a result
Throws: ResultFullException
thrown if this Result has already been yielded a value or exception
